newsitem.title: USA: Duquesne 810 MW Pa. nuke increases power.
newsitem.headline: Duquesne 810 MW Pa. nuke increases power.

text.p: Duquesne Light Co's 810 megawatt (MW) Beaver Valley nuclear power unit 1 is ramping up Friday after being taken off line August 5 for repairs, the company said.
"Unit 1 is at 79 percent (power) this morning," said company spokesman Dennis O'Neil, adding he could not comment on when the unit would return to full power.
The Shippingport, Pa., unit returned to the grid early Thursday after repairs to a reactor coolant pump were completed, he said.
Beaver Valley unit 2, with a generating capacity of 833 MW, is operating at 71 percent power and coasting down to its August 30 refueling outage.
DQE, Duquesne's parent company, owns 47.5 percent of Beaver Valley 1, with the remaining 52.5 percent held by Ohio Edison Co.
